# How to create a procedure for retesting, while still gaining data for publication?

# Assumptions

+ Every quarter we can run 30 tests (120 test per year)
+ Each year we have around 20 rare seed collections

# Data Import
```{r set up}
library(data.table)
library(httr)
library(RCurl)
library(rjson)
library(jsonlite)

# Reading in Caspio Token
source("Tokens/caspioSource.R")
# Reading in caspio GET command (don't know if this works for things > 1000)
source("caspioFunctions.R")

# Read in Datasets
germTest <- caspio_get_table("Germination",login1)
seedAcc <- caspio_get_view("Seed_Accession_All_Info",login1)
germLog <- fread("Data/GerminationLog_2019-Jun-04_2151.csv")

# Select Columns from desired datasets
seedAccLim <- seedAcc[Deaccessioned==0,.(SeedAccessionNumber,ScientificName,CNPSRank,LocalityName,DateSeedCollected,MaternalLinesSampled,DateFrozen)]
```

# Make Table of Status for Each Accession

```{r status}
# Summarize Germination Percent of Tests
germTestMelt <- melt(germTest,
                     id.vars=c("PK_ID","SeedAccessionNumber","TestType","Baseline","Pretreatment","CSWeeks","NumberSeedsPulled","NumGerminants","PercentGerm","StartDate","PullDate","FinalDate","Notes","SeedsPerRep"),
                     measure.vars = names(germTest)[grepl("Init",names(germTest))]
                     ,variable.name="Rep")
                    # ,value.name="InitialCount") # this code is not performing correctly
# Remove "_Init" from rep column
germTestMelt[,Rep:=gsub('Init', '', Rep)]

#melt germLog so that we have one observation for each rep
germLogMelt <- melt(germLog, id.vars = c("GermLogID","GermTestID","DateChange", names(germLog)[15:18]), measure.vars = names(germLog)[5:14], variable.name="Rep",value.name="measurementCount",na.rm=T)
# Remove "_Count" from rep column
germLogMelt[,Rep:=gsub('_.*', '', Rep)]
germLogMelt[,measurementDate:=as.Date(DateChange,format="%m/%d/%Y")]

# Merge together log and germ tests
germMerge <- merge(germTestMelt, germLogMelt, by.x=c("PK_ID","Rep"), by.y=c("GermTestID","Rep"))

# Count the Germinants
germCountsbyRep = germMerge[,.(InitialCount=as.numeric(InitialCount[1]), MaxCount = max(measurementCount,na.rm=T)), by=c("SeedAccessionNumber","PK_ID", "Rep","StartDate","FinalDate","TestType")]
germCountsbyTest  = germCountsbyRep[,.(SeedsTested=sum(InitialCount), Germinants = sum(MaxCount), GermPercent=round(sum(MaxCount)/sum(InitialCount)*100)), by=c("SeedAccessionNumber","TestType","PK_ID","StartDate","FinalDate")]

# Make a Table of the Test Types Completed
germinationSummary <- germination[,.(Baseline=ifelse(grepl("Initial",toString(TestType)),"Yes","No"), 
                                    BaselineStatus=toString(Baseline[TestType=="Initial"])),by="SeedAccessionNumber"]

```
